name: Kepler-31
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-31 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-31 is a star with 1.21 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.22 times its radius. It is located 5699.84 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-31 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-31 b

Kepler-31 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2012-05. Its semi-major axis is 0.16 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 20.86 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-31.

The mass of Kepler-31 b is 57.65 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-31 b is 5.5 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, Kepler-31 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.

Kepler-31 c

Kepler-31 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2012-05. Its semi-major axis is 0.26 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 42.63 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-31.

The mass of Kepler-31 c is 1493.71 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-31 c is 5.3 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, Kepler-31 c is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.

Kepler-31 d

Kepler-31 d was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.40 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 87.65 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-31.

The mass of Kepler-31 d is 2161.11 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-31 d is 3.9 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, Kepler-31 d is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-31, which contains 3 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
